name: B. Number Factorization
statement:
Given an integer n.Consider all pairs of integer arrays a and p of the
same length such that n =
prod a_i^{p_i} (i.e. a_1^{p_1}
cdot a_2^{p_2}
cdot
ldots) (a_i>1;p_i>0) and a_i is the product of some (possibly one) prime
numbers.For example, for n = 28 = 2^2
cdot 7^1 = 4^1
cdot 7^1 the array pair a = [2, 7], p = [2, 1] is correct, but the pair
of arrays a = [4, 7], p = [1, 1] is not, because 4=2^2 is a product of
non-distinct prime numbers.Your task is to find the maximum value of
sum a_i
cdot p_i (i.e. a_1
cdot p_1 + a_2
cdot p_2 +
ldots) over all possible pairs of arrays a and p. Note that you do not
need to minimize or maximize the length of the arrays.
